intro: Ranunculus auricomus subsp. mosanus, commonly known as the Mosan goldcup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for garden cultivation due to its ornamental value.
